Job Title: Material Damage Specialist

Location: United States

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Customer Service, Other

Description:
Aspire General Insurance Company and its affiliated general agent, Aspire General Insurance Services, are on a mission to deliver affordable specialty auto coverage to drivers without compromising outstanding service. 
Our company values can best be described with ABLE: to always do the right thing, be yourself, learn and evolve, and execute. Join our team where every individual takes pride in driving their role for shared success.

About the roleUnder direction of the management team, the Claims Representative- Material Damage/Total Loss performs the essential functions of the position, which includes but is not limited to:
What you'll doReview and audit material damage estimates and supplements and make recommendations as to their accuracy to keep costs down and help oversee any appraisers we employ; Interact with shops, other carriers, customers, and attorneys with regards to the material damage/repair aspect of claims;Document review of appraisals from all sources and make recommendations as to whether appraisals reflect reasonable and customary charges;Dispose of total loss vehicles in a cost effective manner including determining accurate valuations, moving vehicles to storage free locations promptly and handling all total loss settlement in compliance with all laws and regulations;Complies with state and federal laws, Department of Insurance criteria, insurance carrier criteria and follows and enforces Aspire General Insurance/partner’s policies, procedure and work rules;Writes appraisals using licensed software;Regular and predictable punctuality and attendance;Other duties as necessary.QualificationsFive plus years’ experience in Property and Casualty insurance industry;Three years' experience in auto estimatingMust have a clear understanding of insurance industry practices, standards and terminology;Experience handling vehicle estimating, all types of vehicle damage claims and repairs and total losses;Must be able to pass a background check with the anticipated goal of acquiring and maintaining a current Independent Adjuster License with the Department of Insurance; Must have a disciplined approach to all job-related activities;Must have a solid foundation of personal organization, sound decision making and analytical skills, strong interpersonal and customer service skills.

Experience Level (if available): None

output_json.title: Material Damage Specialist
job_responsibilities: Review and audit material damage estimates and supplements
Make recommendations regarding their accuracy to control costs
Interact with shops, other carriers, customers, and attorneys on material damage/repair aspects of claims
Document review of appraisals from all sources
Make recommendations on appraisals reflecting reasonable and customary charges
Dispose of total loss vehicles efficiently
Handle total loss settlements in compliance with laws and regulations
Comply with state and federal laws, Department of Insurance criteria, insurance carrier criteria, and company policies
Follow and enforce company policies, procedures, and work rules
Ensure regular and predictable punctuality and attendance
output_json.company_information: Aspire General Insurance Company and its affiliated general agent, Aspire General Insurance Services, are dedicated to providing affordable specialty auto coverage while maintaining exceptional service.
